page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Beef production is centered on mixed farms and the most popular breeds are the Hereford/Friesian cross and Charolais. Most cereal production is used for the feeding of livestock with only small amounts being sold on the open market. The main crops are wheat and barley. Potatoes, spring cabbage, broccoli and flowers are grown as cash crops and are mainly sent by road transport to the major city markets. A few farmers have small herds of sheep reared for their meat and some rear poultry such as chickens, ducks and geese for the local Christmas market.
